modules.description: Parses IPv6 address strings and URI references from raw input using a streaming parser. Operates on string inputs and produces structured representations of network addresses and URLs. Used to validate and extract components from user-provided network identifiers in networked applications.

Handles HTTP and HTTPS URI construction and parsing, supporting scheme, host, port, path, query, and fragment manipulation. Converts between string representations and structured URI objects, applying percent encoding as needed. Used to generate and analyze URIs in network communication protocols.

Parses and validates URIs according to RFC3986, handling components like scheme, authority, path, query, and fragment. It processes strings and returns structured representations with detailed error reporting. Used to validate user input, extract components from web addresses, and ensure compliance with URI standards.

Converts TCP and UDP port numbers to their corresponding service names and vice versa, using IANA standards. Extracts port numbers from URIs based on scheme or a provided default service. Provides lists of known services and protocol-specific service associations.

Parses and constructs URIs with support for HTTP, HTTPS, and IPv6 addresses, converting between string representations and structured data. Provides operations to extract and modify components such as scheme, host, port, path, query, and fragment. Enables validation of user input, generation of properly encoded URIs, and analysis of network addresses. Examples include parsing a user-entered URL into its components or constructing a URI with encoded query parameters.

Converts TCP and UDP port numbers to their corresponding service names and vice versa, using IANA standards. Extracts port numbers from URIs based on protocol, with fallback service names when no scheme is specified. Provides lists of known services and protocol-specific service associations.
